quest.name: How Tataru Got Her Groove Back
journal: Tataru has grown rather accustomed to her life in Kugane.
objectives: Search Kugane for the overworked porter.
Deliver the magitek field generator manual to Alphinaud in Yanxia.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I suppose I ought to go and take stock of our supplies. We'll be needing a lot of weapons...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: You're here for the parcel Cid sent, right? Wait a moment, and it will be right out!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: It arrived not long ago. A porter delivered it to our offices, along with various other knickknacks from Eorzea.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Cid regrets that he couldn't come here in person. Apparently his hunt for the dragon and Omega demands his full attention, you see...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Still, he was reasonably confident that the documents he provided would be enough for Alphinaud to do the work himself. So as soon as that parcel gets here, we can open it up and see what's inside!

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Pardon my interruption, but the parcel in question─was it the one you placed on the shelf in the back for safekeeping?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: I believe so, yes. Why do you ask?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Well, you see, on closer inspection, said parcel appears to have been addressed to the Sekiseigumi Barracks.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Though it does indeed bulge with a quantity of paper reminiscent of a rather large instruction manual, the lingering scent of lilac leads me to conclude it is in fact a sizable collection of love letters...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: What!? Impossible! That porter was carrying a parcel addressed to us! I saw the writing with my own eyes!

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Oh, I do not doubt that in the least. However, as he was tasked with a number of deliveries, I can only presume that he handed you another parcel by mistake.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: This is a disaster! We have to find that porter right this instant!

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: My, she can move quickly when she has a mind to do so. So quickly she neglected to take these love letters with her. They too must be redirected to their rightful recipient.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: They should also aid you in tracking down the right porter. They keep records of their deliveries and so forth, after all.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: The man in question was of middling height and build. Not unlike myself. Black hair, short─terribly helpful in Kugane, I know. A cheery sort. Wearing bright colors, as I recall?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: I will send a few of my men out to search, but in the meantime, why don't you take the parcel and see if you can't track him down yourself? I will wait here, on the off chance he realizes his mistake and returns.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Short, black hair, light-colored garments. In all other respects, not unlike myself. But then, I am so terribly unremarkable, am I not?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Hey, you! Yeah, you! You came by the Ruby Bazaar earlier, right? Where's my parcel!?

dialogue.name: MAND02946
dialogue.text: Why are you yelling at me!? Who are you!?

dialogue.name: MANA02946
dialogue.text: Hm? Who are you? You seek company? For an hour or an evening?

dialogue.name: MANA02946
dialogue.text: Ugh, how it reeks of perfume and desperation. I know naught of it, nor do I wish to know.

dialogue.name: MANB02946
dialogue.text: Oh dear, oh dear... I misplaced some most important documents, and if I do not find them quickly, there will be dire repercussions...

dialogue.name: MANB02946
dialogue.text: No, no, it is nothing so scandalous and base! <sigh> My lord is a man with singular dietary restrictions, which I have detailed in my notebook. I cannot purchase produce without it!

dialogue.name: MANC02946
dialogue.text: A good eveningmorningday to you, misssir, but I have no time to chat! I have to head to the Bokairo! ...Or was it the Hostelry? Bah, no time, no time!

dialogue.name: MANC02946
dialogue.text: Hm? Aye, I recognize that parcel. I delivered it to the Ruby Bazaar not long ago. What of it?

dialogue.name: MANC02946
dialogue.text: Eh? A mistake? For the Sekiseigumi, you say?

dialogue.name: MANC02946
dialogue.text: Bah, you're right! How stupid of me. Fortunately, I have yet to visit the barracks. This is for you, yes? I will take the other in exchange.

dialogue.name: MANA02946
dialogue.text: Oh, if only I could relax like this every day...

dialogue.name: MANB02946
dialogue.text: I suppose I could try to buy produce without it. What is the worst that could happen? He could...get very sick, or perhaps die...and the Sekiseigumi could judge me a murderer and execute me... Oh dear...

dialogue.name: MANC02946
dialogue.text: I must remember to be more careful! The last thing I need is to be cursed by my customers...

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Back already? Tataru is as well. She couldn't find the porter, in case you're wondering.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, I couldn't find him. I guess we just have to hope he realizes his mistake and returns soon...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: That's it! That's the parcel! You found him!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Though, knowing our luck, Cid put the wrong papers in here...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Nope, this is it! These are the documents detailing the operation of the magitek field generators Alphinaud requested!

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: I can only imagine what would have happened had we sent Forename back to Doma with a parcel full of love letters. The look on Alphinaud's face when he reads the first page... On second thought, I'm a little disappointed we didn't.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Everyone's working so hard to fight for Doma's freedom, and here I am, making the same silly mistakes...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: It won't happen again, Forename! And I'll keep working hard to bring you and the others useful information!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: If we hear anything new, we'll contact you straightaway!

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Oh, and you may be pleased to hear that we have brokered an arrangement between the company and the Confederacy. They require armaments, we provide. Discreetly, and at a reasonable price.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: I'm sure Lord Lolorito was pleased to hear it.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Ahaha! Indeed he was, indeed he was.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Well, it seems our time together is at an end! Give Alphinaud and Alisaie my regards, will you?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: We've got eyes on the Garlean embassy, just so you know. If we notice anything suspicious, you'll be the first to hear about it.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: I can see it now. Confederate ships sailing up the One River, equipped with the finest Lominsan-made cannons, provided by the East Aldenard Trading Company. The world is not as big as it once was, my friend.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So much to do, and so little time to do it...

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: You are returned from Kugane? How fares Tataru?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Oh! It seems like just yesterday you were here. Our plans proceed apace. Do you have the documents?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Excellent! This looks to be exactly what we need.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Assuming our shinobi escort can see us safely inside the Moon Gates, I should have no trouble deactivating the barrier. Good, good─that is one less thing to worry about...

obj.n: From the Bottom of My Gut
